name: Wolfgang's Steakhouse
address: 409 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10013, USA

reviews.text: My place on earth. I eat a lot of steaks, mainly tenderloin, this is my nr 3 best steak in the world. Thanks and see You again!

Experience and meal certainly did not live up to the price and name. Ordered the porterhouse and while decent, could not compare to competitorsâ€™ within the price range (Empire Steakhouse etc.). Tuna and fillet mignon was decent and portions were good. Service, however, needs to be greatly improved, especially for a steakhouse at this price point. Bread was served cold and when asked, the server simply dismissed it. Plates were thrown on to the table, no explanation of the sauces/dishes were given and the server felt unhappy to serve our table in general. Automatic 20% tip was still included in the bill but we did not agree to it given the lacklustre service. Gentleman at the front of house however was cheery, helpful and welcoming.

Das Essen war fÃ¼r 500 Dollar ein purer Witz, mein lachs war schlecht gewÃ¼rzt und dass steak meines Vaters noch roh (medium gegrillt) die WÃ¤nde waren dreckig und fÃ¼r dass ganze hÃ¤tte ich am liebsten geld gekriegt um mich dort hinzusetzen dennoch waren die Keller nett 1 stern aber am liebsten 0

I went for the first time last night. And let me tell you that this beat all of my expectations. The ambiance is very grown and sexy, the decor is nice. But the food was phenomenal!! We ordered oysters, lobster soup, mozzarella and tomatoes, porter house steak, filet mignon, cream spinach, potatoes, and lobster Mac and cheese. For dessert we had a little bit of everything. The steak was seasoned so well, it was the best steak I have had in a long time. Everything was amazing! Alfred was our waiter and he was so attentive, and patient in answering all of our questions, we felt so comfortable with him and at home. Will definitely be coming back!
Nice meat big steaks

This is a top tier Stake house with the best service,great ambiance and fabulous food every time we go to NYC we make our reservations and enjoy this   Location. Worth every penny best presentation and atmosphere.

I booked a table for 4. The dining room was extremely noisy and the ambience reminded more of Arby's than of an expensive steakhouse. Children were running all over, loud parties, long wait for the service these are some of the things you will find there. Regarding the food - ordered a salad and fillet mignion and both were OK and nothing outstanding. The service was a a real horrible expereince. Waiters are very angry and clearly did not want to be there. They rushed the party with the service, pulling plates while someone in the party who is a slow eater was trying to slice the meet, were generally rude. Never explained about the menue options. It was really a horrible expereince. Never again.

Our server was lack luster at best, perhaps he had a long day but he was not warm, friendly, nor helpful. The food was also just meh, not flavorful, not great, just meh. We had the lamb and fish. The bread was served cold and when asked could it be heated the server said no-we dont have a place for it. Overall just an ok experience which is disappointing when you are looking forward to and paid for an excellent one.
Steak was good! Little undercooked but still amazing. Tender and delicious!
Very attentive and delicious food!!We all loved this restaurant!!

Very upscale steak house . Very   Aesthetically pleasing .

The hostess could have a more warming greet . But fortunately the waiters take over after . So I guess it evens out lol .

Iâ€™ve had steak before and it was fantastic .

Was really in the sweet tooth mood . The chocolate mousse cake was to die for . Had this amazing chocolate crunch . Was so impressed .

Ribeye and chopped salad was very enjoyable. Steak has the perfect outside crust.

Donâ€™t come here if you are on a budget. Definitely will add up .

Falling in ğŸ§¡ with steak and seafood all over again.  The food is divine.  Cocktails too.  The greeter at the door is questionable, abrasive and didnâ€™t know how to welcome the largest group of guests in the room with a corporate account, suspiciously asking if we were going to order any food.  Management, please do a better job, and donâ€™t sweep any food or drinks away without first asking and then actually looking at the response.

Great steakhouse experience. The steak was excellent and the key lime pie was a standout. Cheesecake looked good but tasted a bit dry. Would definitely come back for the steak and dessert.
And, worth mentioning - very decent gimlet!

Love this place 1000/10

Pros:
- filet mignon
- Porterhouse for 2
- CÃ©sar salad
- steak fries
- ALL THE DESSERTS especially pecan pie and sundae
- Brussel sprouts are a YUM
- great service and really thorough wine list, they have Chianti Classico on the wine by the glass menu which is a plus
- amazing space, the bar is gorgeous and classic and the tall ceilings are beautiful

We've been several Wolfgang's including Hawaii, but this branch is the worst. Waiter's not helpful: slow, using kinda condescending words, the lady at the front even not say good bye when we left. No wonder it wat not that busy at all during lunch time.
ê°€ê²©ì€ ë¹„ì‹¸ì§€ë§Œ í•œë²ˆì¯¤ ì™€ë³¼ë§Œí•œ ê³³
5/5 star no drama
Ordered a rare ribeye steak.  I was not prepared for how amazing it tasted and looked. I asked for Pittsburgh rare, but they call it black and blue.
Good steak, fantastic service. Staff were very tentative - not the greatest ambiance but well worth it. We were staying down the street at Hotel Fouquet's so it was a pleasurable walk back home.

I and my wife ordered Sirloin steak, Rib eye steak. I thought the mashed potatoes and Caesar salad were side dish of the steak but now I see they were added separately on the receipts. Foods taste good, BV Cabernet Sauvignon Napa valley  red wine was excellent. The server was kind too. The only problem was we ordered too much portion for 2 people. I dare not even think about beef steak for 2 months afterwards lol
Hudson River Park is nearby. We took a stroll there after the meal. This restaurant is in Tribeca area. Good to look around.

Fantastic dining experience at Wolfgangâ€™s Steakhouse in Tribeca!
Started with the seafood tower was  fresh and delicious. Sides were on point: crispy fries, creamy mashed potatoes, and buttery spinach. Finished strong with their apple strudel topped with ice cream and a healthy dose of schlag!

Classic New York steakhouse vibes and everything hit just right. Will definitely be backâ€¦
Not best, but good.

First time here and I must say I was impressed with everything. Had reservations and got seated promptly.  I got the rib eye- med rare and it was done to perfection. The lobster mac and cheese was good, it could've used a bit more salt/pepper. The cream spinach was ridiculously fresh and done well. Everyone thoroughly enjoyed that. I'm trying that tomahawk next!

Dining here was a mixed experience. The atmosphere was lively and the service pleasant, but the food left a bit to be desired. I had a cocktail, which was well-crafted and honestly the highlight of the evening.
I ordered the filet mignon with a side of mashed potatoesâ€”surprisingly, the side wasnâ€™t included and came at an extra cost. The mashed potatoes were creamy and comforting, but the steak was on the dry side. The sauce helped, but it didnâ€™t quite make up for the lack of flavor.
Overall, not a terrible dining experience, but food-wise it didnâ€™t stand out. I wonâ€™t be rushing back anytime soon.

My friend who is visiting me from syracuse wanted to have a steak in Wolf Gang steak. One of the worst experiences for me and my friend.
The bread they served is not fresh. The butter is frozen. I asked the waiter to get room temp butter he refused.
My friendâ€™s steak is dry and tasteless. My salmon, I ordered medium rare came well done with not fully cleaned. They donâ€™t give any sides so we ordered steak fries and mashed potatoes. Huge portion came. They think itâ€™s steak fries but these are French fries. I donâ€™t believe they know the difference. Wolf Gang- you need to eat yourself !

I am a big fan of steaks and when I get the opportunity I like try different places to rate which place have the best meat, this time was Wolfgan's and it was pretty much like Peter Luger but in my opinion Peter has my vote so far, food was good but the porterhouse for 2 was a bit chewy in a couple of spots and I didn't get my chocolate coins at the end wich my daughter loves but other than that  it was good.
I've priced and tired.
I donâ€™t care what anyone says- this is the best Wolfgangâ€™s in NYC. Food is so good and the space is beyond incredible. Canâ€™t wait to come back.
War frÃ¼her deutlich besser, vor allem der Service hat leider nachgelassen.

Spectacular porterhouse!!!
Best in downtown.

We had a lunch last week. 4 people. (East Asians)
The food was great. All of us were satisfied with the food and atmosphere.

We had a conversation in Korean. The server might think we would not speak English fluently or do not understand the tip culture properly.
We were wiling to pay the proper amount of tip (20%) as we leave the place.

However, the server pointed his finger on the receipt to force us to pay the tip.
That was so rude.

If you think about the price of the service, that kind of incident should not happen.

It would be nice if we can receive proper apology from the restaurant.
ì‹œê·¸ë‹ˆì²˜ ë©”ë‰´ ë§›ìˆê³  ë¹µë„ ë§›ìˆê³ ..ì–‘ë§ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤..

Been going for over 16 years. Every time we are in NY.
Food is outstanding along with the service. Absolutely the best steak house by far. The wine is phenomenal too.

the food and drink was really good and the staff was friendly but they could be a bit more attentive. We noticed the other waiters focused more on other people than on us. We had to ask for different menus while others sitting right next to us had them offered. I would go again but just got the food. The bartender was really nice though. He offered suggestions on drinks when I couldnâ€™t decide.

It was my birthday dinner. We split two porter houses amongst seven of us and filled in with appetizers and potatoes. The steaks were done to perfection. The desserts contain an enormous amount of whipped cream that is truly out of this world. Expect a really good steakhouse experience, but you have to love steakhouses
Food and service is Excellent
excellent stake and service!
Love it

Omg! Najlepsze steki w mieÅ›cieğŸ˜³ Åšwietne miejsce! ObsÅ‚uga przyjazna oraz  klimat jest Å›wietny.
Na przystawkÄ™ zamÃ³wiliÅ›my, pomidora z cebulÄ… i blue cheese sauce - nie myÅ›laÅ‚em, Å¼e to bÄ™dzie takie dobre. Pomidor ğŸ…
soczysty, peÅ‚en smaku (nie wodnisty) a cebulağŸ§… bardzo lekka, nie miaÅ‚a intensywnego posmaku cebuli. Do tego blue cheese sauce dodaje smaku i â€Å‚Ä…czy skÅ‚adnikiâ€.
Na drugie danie, wziÄ™liÅ›my ogromnego stekağŸ¥© z ziemniaki ğŸ¥” i szpinakiem. Pycha! Stek soczysty, peÅ‚en smaku i idealnie usmaÅ¼onyâ€¦. Ziemniaki z cebulkÄ… teÅ¼ pyszne wraz ze szpinakiem.
Na zakoÅ„czenie naszej â€kulinarnej podrÃ³Å¼yâ€ wziÄ™liÅ›my ciasto czekoladowe z bitÄ… Å›mietanÄ… na spÃ³Å‚kÄ™ - teÅ¼ przepyszne!
Jak ktoÅ› chce zjeÅ›Ä‡ najlepszego steka ğŸ¥© w NYC, to to jest to miejsce!
Polecam;)

The food here was actually quite good â€” my steak was cooked perfectly and full of flavor. Unfortunately, the service really didnâ€™t match the quality of the kitchen. Staff was barely present, and it was hard to get even basic attention during the meal. No check-ins, no refills, and we felt pretty much ignored.

Great food, but the overall experience was let down by poor service.

Weâ€™ve spent thousands here over the past few months. Brought friends. Celebrated. Recommended it to everyone. The last three visits were perfect.

Last night? Complete collapse.
â€¢ The wrong porterhouse was delivered
â€¢ Instead of replacing it, they used a Band-Aid fix â€” put it back in the oven, which overcooked it and ruined the entire meal
â€¢ Our waiter disappeared for over 20 minutes
â€¢ They offered a sirloin and by the time it came, the sides were cold and lifeless
â€¢ No comp, no apology - just a check with a full charge for a sirloin we didnâ€™t touch

The worst part? The manager shows up not to make it right, but to insinuate weâ€™ve complained before.

I donâ€™t care how good it used to be. You donâ€™t treat loyal guests like this. Ever.

Weâ€™re done. And anyone Iâ€™ve sent here will hear why.

Ich war mit meiner Familie (7Personen) am Dienstag (15.04.2025) dort abends zu Essen. Wir hatten sowohl Fleisch- als auch Fischgerichte und alle Beilagen. Die Steaks und Fische waren sehr gut zubereitet, aber viel zu groÃŸe Portionen, die vermutlich die hohen Preise rechtfertigen sollen. Die Beilagen waren in Ordnung. Was allerdings unterirdisch war, war der Service. Alle 3 Kellner, die uns bedient hatten, haben uns alles eher auf den Tisch geworfen, anstatt es elegant abzulegen. Die Klimaanlage war dauerhaft an und wir hatten teilweise unsere Jacken an. Auf Nachfrage wurde uns gesagt dass man die Temperatureinstellung nicht Ã¤ndern konnte.
Insgesamt war das Essen gut, aber der Service bei Ã¼ber 1.000$ Rechnung nicht akzeptabel.

Essen war Mega vielleicht etwas groÃŸ. Ich empfehle die Portionen auf zu teilen .
Der Service war bodenlos fÃ¼r den Preis . Die Kellner haben uns die Karten hingeworfen, Wein wurde wie Wasser eingeschÃ¼ttet und uns wurden die Dessert Teller einfach hingeworfen.Und das beste ist das sie dann am Ende noch selber ihr Trinkgeld bestimmt was nicht auf ihren Service angeglichen ist .

This is probably the best steakhouse in NYC. The steak is served hot and buttery, the Canadian bacon is thick and delicious, and the even the salads are great. The prices are fairly reasonable, given that itâ€™s Tribeca. I would also highly recommend the tartufo.
This place sucks. Food is low quality, my girlfriend found a lipstick mark on her water glass. Just avoid.
A steak sandwitch was pretty decent for lunch.

We went April 5 and ordered a 4 pound lobster. I cook lobsters, have family in Maine who are lobster fishermen and there was no way the lobster they served was a four pounder.  If it was a 2.5 pounder I would be surprised. They served it already opened and out of shell. I was shocked they had the audacity to pull a fast one like they pulled. Wolfgang is a very well respected restaurant that we go to when family is in town.
Truly it makes me not want to patronize them any longer. The thick bacon app was amazing. The Fillet wasnâ€™t melt in your mouth but seasoned well. The baked clams were very good.
I just canâ€™t get over the lobster.

While usually my favorite steakhouse my recent visit was decidedly underwhelming.  A flavorless steak, a very warm creme brule made made a celebration dinner a disappointment.  I hope this was a one off, but birthday fell far short of expectations.

Wolfgangâ€™s Steakhouse is just as great as Peter Luger in terms of steak quality, flavor, and overall dining experience. The **only difference** between the two is that Wolfgangâ€™s offers **more side options**, which gives it a slight edge in variety. Other than that, they are very much the sameâ€”both serve top-tier steaks, have a classic steakhouse atmosphere, and provide solid service. If youâ€™re looking for a great steakhouse with more side choices, Wolfgangâ€™s is a strong contender.

Heard a lot about Wolfgangâ€™s, but it was my first time. I thought it was a luxury steakhouse but it was actually quite â€œcivilâ€. Spacious and cozy interior. Our waiter seemed a little â€œmechanicalâ€ at the beginning, talking like a robot, but it turned out he was actually a nice guy. Steak (Porterhouse) was among the top ones I had in NYC. Also the sides were pretty good (even though a lot of garlic, we had some problems sleeping afterwards). Recommended.

It was a very average night out dining experience. Mediocre service, food was up to par, but not exceptional (I ordered lump crab meat and it was good, but as a Maryland girl I like great). The bass I ate was very nice and I enjoyed the lobster Mac and cheese. The steak for three was huge for a table of five. Oh, and they don't warm their bread so there's that... otherwise it's a suitable late-night dining option

Food is top tier, we started with two entrees the jumpo shrimp cocktail & crab cake, steak well done and medium rare done, salmon and ended with dessert all delicious and made to perfection.

Now my mother and I  arrived early and weâ€™re waiting on our family friend to join us, and at several times the waiters were no where to be found. When our third guest arrived then they were consistently checking and waiting on us, granted myself and my mother had never been here but our family friend that invited us is a regular. I donâ€™t know if them knowing who our family friend was changed the tone of the service but before they arrived it was mediocre.

Love the details of the ceiling and the history of the restaurants inception.

Sono stato in questa Steakhouse in vacanza con due amici di cui abita a NY da molti anni. Posso dire che la location Ã¨ favolosa e la carne di qualitÃ  molto superiore a quella Italiana. I prezzi non sono economici per standard italiani ma per la grande mela sono piÃ¹ che onesti. I ragazzi della sala sono professionali e preparati. Voglio fare un ringraziamento ad Albert il capo sala che ci ha consigliato nel migliore dei modi addirittura consigliandoci di non ordinare troppe portate che non avremmo finito.

First, I need to just say WOW. The absolute best steak I have ever had. Myself and 2 friends went to celebrate our July Birthdays. We started with a couple of cocktails which were great. Appetizers were one piece of thick cut bacon, 1/2 dozen oysters and fresh tomato and mozzarella. The bacon, which they cut into thirds, was incredible. Nice crisp on outside, juicy on inside with the perfect amount of fat. Oysters were super fresh and clean. The mozzarella was perfect consistency and tomato's were sweet. Porterhouse for 3 was cooked rare, as ordered. It was rare throughout with a nice char on the outside. The oil they use to cook on the plate was spectacular. We all dipped the pieces into it. Sides were creamed spinach, which was a vibrant green and delicious, German potatoes, crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside, and lobster Mac and cheese which had huge chunks of lobster. Dessert was tartufo, which I never order and it was delicious, and pecan pie. Both came with home made whipped cream, or schlag. It was super thick and cut the sweetness.  The service was attentive without hovering and the room is beautiful. I can't wait for another special occasion or for me to get a job where I can afford to go every week.

Went back last night and had an even better time. The waiter Alfred was amazing and as usual the food is 5 stars. Highly recommend this place.

Delicious steak and shrimp. Drinks were perfect. Service was good but they did forget several things. And it was extremely loud. But all in all we had a great time. I would recommend the Park ave. location.

1- Food  5/5. EXCELLENT. Wolfgangs food stays constantly delicious in all of the 3 locations we have dined in. From there Seafood Tower which tastes fresh and well prepared to there Sizzling Canadian Bacon itâ€™s all delicious. All the sides we order are sharable and tasty. And do I have to say this again,,that Wolfgangs Steaks are absolutely amazing and definitely top 3 if not #1 in all New York. Drinks are always on point at Wolfgangs.
2 - Service 3/5 GOOD.  Drinks were delivered fast and correctly. Not so engaging waitstaff and table took way too long to be cleared considering the tables are very small and tightly packed.
3 - Ambiance 3/5. GOOD. Seated in the bar area didnâ€™t seem fitting what I consider fine ding especially because we had reservations. This area looks to be for last minute drop in diners. Very cold night and there is a considerable draft when the door opens up in this bar room area. Probably would think higher of this location if we sat in the main dining room instead of there tightly squeezed in bar room.
4 - Reservations 5/5 EXCELLENT. Same day made. Not too busy this place I guess.
5 - Value  3/5. GOOD. Prices are always reasonable at Wolfgangs considering this is a top notch Steakhouse. We prefer there park Ave and there 37th street location better for reasons stated. Probably would return and more than likely, I  will NOT recommend for now.
